alert.note: Alert for Waupaca; Waushara; Winnebago (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 6:26PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Winnebago, eastern Waushara and south central Waupaca Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 626 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Napowan Scout Camp to 8 miles east of Westfield. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Napowan Scout Camp around 630 PM CDT. Fremont and Lake Poygan around 655 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Saxeville, Lind Center, Mount Morris, Orihula, Auroraville, Borth, Silver Lake, Spring Lake, Lohrville and Zittau. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
